You are behind me by a couple posts. I must be getting them faster. :)

---=
 On Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@...> wrote:


From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo.=
com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Mon=
day, June 8, 2009, 3:26 PM












You are confusing the oscillation fr=
equency (vibration) of the air and our ear drums, with the oscillation freq=
uency of electromagnetic energy.=A0 

For example, we can hear sound waves =
between around 40 Hz at the lower end to about 16,000 Hz at the higher end.=
=A0 These are sound pressure waves.

In the EM spectrum. some of those regi=
ons are covered by radio VLF (3000 Hz to 30,000 hz), and ULF (300 Hz, to 30=
00hz). These are radio frequencies, and you can't hear them: they are elect=
romagnetic energy, traveling in photons (yes, it is valid to call non-visib=
le EM energy a photon).=A0 


--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii=
@ yahoo.com> wrote:


From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>
Subject: =
Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, =
2009, 1:05 PM









Tell me where the seperation on the spectrum takes p=
lace between 300Hz and 300KHz. Yes, soundwaves cause pressure waves that ou=
r ears read as vibration and our mind translates as sound. The waves are st=
ill on the electromagnetic spectrum. Even subsonic geomagnetic waves are pr=
esent on the scale. What I mean by power can be directll translated to volu=
me or amplitude. The only thing that distinguishes soundwaves from any othe=
r wave is the fact that we can hear them.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09,=
 Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com>
Subject: =
Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, =
2009, 2:53 PM








No. Sounds waves are not on the electromagnet spectru=
m nor are they a form of electromagnet energy. Sound waves are based on pre=
ssure waves in the air (or in other substances).=A0 Our ears detect these p=
ressure waves and translate them into sounds we here.=A0 Our ear do NOT hea=
r electromagnet energy.=A0 Our eyes do: that part which we call visible lig=
ht.



--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wrote:


F=
rom: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas=

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:38 PM








=

It sounds like she's saying "one, two, ....."
=A0
A mistake that a lot of =
people make is thinking that there are two different types of energy at wor=
k when it comes to sound waves and electromagnetic waves. The only thing th=
at seperates them is frequency and power. Radio waves are radio waves becau=
se they occupy a certain block of the electromagnietic spectrum. Sound wave=
s exist on that same spectrum just farther down with much longer waves. Sou=
ndwaves and subsonic waves can penetrate almost anything because of their w=
avelengths. The shorter the wavelength the more ways we can shield against =
them.
=A0
Think of microwaves. These are also a type of radio and telemetry=
 transmitting wave but the waves also have a physical effect on our environ=
ment by causing molecules to speed up, which creates heat. A little lower t=
han this is IR or infrared it too can cause physical objects to heat up but=
 usually it just causes molecules to rotate in place. All physical things g=
ive off IR light. Its a way the total system conserves energy by spontaneou=
sly emitting IR radiation.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrom=
bie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


From: April Abercrombie=
 <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas [3=
 Attachments]
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27=
 PM





Here is some food for thought. I am currently reviewing my audio f=
rom our May 30th investigation.
=A0
It was me and another girl teammate=A0p=
resent in the room. I picked up a 3rd female voice on my digital voice reco=
rder that I carry with me. We were standing right next to another digital v=
ideo recorder that I leave beside my night vision camera. That recorder did=
 not pick up this 3rd voice. I have asked the girl that was with me to chec=
k her recording to see if she picked it up.
=A0
I have long felt the true E=
VP does not come from sound waves in the environment, or then it wouldn't b=
e EVP, but a disembodied voice. Somehow EVP's are appearing directly on the=
 recordings.
=A0
This instance with the recorders may back that theory up. =
That other recorder should have picked that voice up if it were sound waves=
 in the environment.
=A0
I am attaching the clip of this 3rd voice. The=A0f=
ile that is named=A0"01-02-17 Clip" is the full clip.=A0You will hear my vo=
ice as I say "Yeah", and then another comes in right after that. I think I =
know what it says.
=A0
Again, I was live monitoring my audio, but still did=
 not hear this until playback. It isn't clear, so I am not as excited about=
 it as my one's from the last investigation.
=A0
=A0

----- Original Messag=
e ----- 
From: Frank Ratka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Monday, Jun=
e 08, 2009 1:09 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas








I have a runnin=
g theory that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly =
where they want it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If y=
ou mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one another in frequency then if yo=
u add or subtract them together you get a beat frequency or alternate frequ=
ency. For example, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an =
electric fan in a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you w=
ill have a intermediate difference=A0frequency at 9KHz, well within human h=
earing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electronic =
equipment generates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From this t=
heory I always felt that EVP were generated within a few inches of the reco=
rder.
=A0
We are able to reproduce this affect in not only radio with super=
heterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in some passive son=
ars and a commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pom=
peii.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com> w=
rote:


From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New =
ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:56 PM




=

Fascinating! I've had this idea that the EVP are often=A0not recorded by t=
he microphone but somehow make their way in at the actual=A0point where the=
 storage is made, whether it be analog (tape) or digital.=A0

So much we do=
n't know ...
=A0
Zack

=A0
On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombi=
e <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:









I monitor my audio=
 live. The funny thing is that even so, those last EVP's I captured I did n=
ot hear either in the environment, or on my recording as it happened. I onl=
y heard them upon playback.
=A0


----- Original Message ----- 
From: Zack =
Widup 

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 



Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 =
AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas




I am curious if anyone with a micro=
phone wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EVP in real time.
=A0
I=A0=
took part in=A0an investigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Sat=
urday night. We had six video cameras set up in the three halls of the buil=
ding. The video for all=A0was being monitored and recorded=A0at a central l=
ocation. Alas, we did not have microphones at the camera sites conected to =
the central location. I wonder what we might have heard if we did?
=A0
Zack=


=A0

frared it too can cause physical objects to heat up but usually it just cau=
ses molecules to rotate in place. All physical things give off IR light. It=
s a way the total system conserves energy by spontaneously emitting IR radi=
ation.</DIV>

<DIV>I have a running theory that EVP is carried on an untrasoni=
c wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to manifest. It works off=
 the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one =
another in frequency then if you add or subtract them together you get a be=
at frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is sending a s=
ignal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creating an untrasoni=
c frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate difference freq=
uency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was ju=
st an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic signals ju=
st by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP were generat=
ed within a few inches of the recorder.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>We are=
 able to reproduce this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne syste=
ms but also with acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a commer=
cial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.</DIV>
<DIV=
> </DIV>

<DIV>So much we don't know ...</DIV>
